abstract: Prosecutors are looking at whether traders manipulated the market for credit-default swaps to drive down the price of financial shares over the last year.
snippet: Prosecutors are looking at whether traders manipulated the market for credit-default swaps to drive down the price of financial shares over the last year.
lead_paragraph: In an unusual partnership, New York State and federal prosecutors are investigating trading in credit-default swaps, the insurancelike securities that have come under close scrutiny for their role in the financial crisis.

headline.main: Joint U.S.-New York Inquiry Into Credit-Default Swaps
headline.print_headline: Joint U.S.-New York Inquiry Into Credit-Default Swaps
